ext_descriptions.ext_description: A planar_curve_select is an extensible select type used to specify the the types of planar curve that are used to construct sketches. The select options are fully defined with the corresponding MIM object from ISO 10303-108, this contains further selections together with rules to ensure their planarity.
A sketch_basis_select specifies those types of planar geometric element that may serve as the basis for the definition of an instance of .
A sketch_element_select is an extensible select type used to specify the types of basic geometric element that can be used as components in the definition of a sketch.
Each select element shall be of type .
A sketch_type_select is a select type used to specify the possible types of sketch.

A surface_or_solid_model is an extensible select type used to specify the the types of three dimensional geometric element that can be intersected by the plane of a sketch. The select options are fully defined with the corresponding MIM object from ISO 10303-108.
A curves_or_area is an enumeration type used to determine whether a neutral sketch is to be interpreted as a set of general curves or as the area enclosed by a set of closed curves.
the two dimensional sketch shall be interpreted as a set of general two-dimensional curves;
the sketch shall be interpreted as the area bounded by a set of closed two-dimensional curves.

An Implicit_explicit_sketch_relationship is a relationship between the implicit and explicit representations of a positioned sketch. These are, respectively, instances of and . When mapped to the corresponding MIM object there is an additional constraint to ensure that the implicit and explicit representations of the positioned sketch shall share at least one common representation context.
an implicit, transformation based, definition of a positioned sketch.
an explicit definition of the same positioned sketch.

A Implicit_planar_intersection_curve is a type of
and of
that is an implicit representation for an imported intersection curve in the plane of a positioned sketch instance. The curve is defined by intersection of a specified surface with the plane of the sketch. This entity is not fully defined in the ARM, in the corresponding MIM object there is an additional derived attribute representing the plane of intersection.
the instance in which the imported implicit curve is used, this also defines the plane of the intersection.
an explicit representation of the imported , computed from the implicit representation.
the element used to define the intersection curve.

A Implicit_planar_intersection_point is a type of
that is an implicit representation for an imported intersection point in the plane of a positioned sketch instance. The point is defined by intersection of a specified curve with the plane of the sketch. This entity is not fully defined in the ARM, in the corresponding MIM object there is an additional derived attribute representing the plane of intersection.
the instance in which the imported implicit point is used, this also defines the plane of the intersection.
an explicit representation of the imported point, computed from the implicit representation.
the element used to define the intersection .

A Implicit_planar_model_intersection_curve is a type of
and of
that is an implicit representation for an imported intersection curve in the plane of a positioned sketch instance. The curve is defined by intersection of a specified solid or surface model with the plane of the sketch. This entity is not fully defined in the ARM, in the corresponding MIM object there is an additional derived attribute representing the plane of intersection.
the instance in which the imported implicit curve is used, this also defines the plane of the intersection.
an explicit representation of the imported , computed from the implicit representation.

ext_description.p: the solid or surface model used to define the intersection curve.
ext_description.note: In the corresponding MIM object the select type coresponding to this attribute is fully populated.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A Implicit_planar_projected_curve is a type of
and of
that is an implicit representation for an imported projection curve in the plane of a positioned sketch instance. The curve is defined by projection of a specified curve onto the plane of the sketch. This entity is not fully defined in the ARM, in the corresponding MIM object there is an additional derived attribute representing the plane of intersection.
the instance in which the imported implicit curve is used, this also defines the plane of the projection.

ext_description.p: an explicit representation of the imported , computed from the implicit representation.
ext_description.note: The corresponduing MIM oject has an informal proposition that requires this curve to be identical to the external_curve if the external_curve lies in the plane of the sketch.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the element used to define the intersection curve.

ext_description.p: the element used to define the projection onto the plane.
ext_description.note: The corresponding MIM oject has an informal proposition that requires this direction not to be parallel to the plane of the sketch.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
A Implicit_planar_projection_point is a type of
that is an implicit representation for a projection of a point in the plane of a positioned sketch instance. This entity is not fully defined in the ARM, in the corresponding MIM object there is an additional derived attribute representing the plane of intersection.
the instance in which the imported implicit point is used, this also defines the plane of the projection.

ext_description.p: an explicit representation of the imported , computed from the implicit representation.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
the
element used to define the projected point.

ext_description.p: the element used to define the projection onto the plane.
ext_description.note: The corresponding MIM oject has an informal proposition that requires this direction to be at an angle to the plane of the sketch.

ext_descriptions.ext_description:
An Implicit_planar_silhouette_curve is a type of
and of
that is an implicit representation for an imported silhouette curve in the plane of a positioned sketch instance. The curve is generated by parallel projection of the visual profile of a solid or surface model, viewed in a specified direction, onto the plane of the sketch. The explicit computed version of the silhouette curve, corresponding to the attribute computed_representation, will generally be a composite curve.
This entity is not fully defined in the ARM, the corresponding MIM object there is an additional derived attribute representing the plane of intersection.
the instance in which the imported implicit curve is used, this also defines the plane of the projection.
an explicit representation of the imported , computed from the implicit representation.
the surface or solid model used as the basis for generating the silhouette curve.
the direction of parallel projection of the surface or solid model profile onto the sketch plane.

A Positioned_sketch is a type of that is planar sketch in 3D space. It serves to distinguish planar geometric configurations that are subjected to sweep operations or used as section curves in the construction of skinned or lofted surfaces. In a CAD system, such a configuration may be created directly in three dimensional model space or may be derived from a neutral 2D sketch by the application of a transformation.
the instance of , curve bounded surface, or face surface that defines the geometry of the Positioned_sketch.
imported or other auxiliary geometric elements with respect to which geometric elements of the sketch may be constrained.

A Repositioned_sketch_2d_in_3d is a type of that is the re-use of a in 3D space. It provides details of the transformation applied to a two-dimensional sketch representation instance to reposition it in three-dimensional model space. This entity data type only defines the sketch geometry implicitly, in terms of the neutral sketch geometry and the transformation applied. The transformation has the effect of raising the dimensionality of the geometric elements of the original sketch from two to three.
the representation whose geometry is being mapped, in this case a that defines the geometry of the Repositioned_sketch_2d_in_3d.
the coordinate axes for the two dimensional space of the .

a three dimensional that defines the location and orientation in three dimensional space of the repositioned 2D sketch. The two-dimensional x- and y-axes of the original sketch are aligned with the corresponding axes of this three-dimensional .
The dimensionality of the that is the mapping_origin shall be 2.
The dimensionality of the that is the mapping_target shall be 3.

A Rigid_subsketch is a type of with additional constraints. The elements of an instance of Rigid_subsketch are required to remain invariant in shape and in their relationships with respect to each other when the sketch to which they belong is edited, while the location and orientation of the subsketch as a whole may change subject to constraint relationships with other elements not belonging to the subsketch. The intended effect is that the group of elements behaves as a rigid body.

A Sketch_2d_representation is a type of that is a representation of planar configurations of geometry that are defined in some neutral 2D coordinate space and may be stored in libraries for reuse in a variety of circumstances. All geometric elements participating in an instance of Sketch_2d_representation are required to be two-dimensional. Such an instance may represent either a set of general curves or the area bounded by a set of non-intersecting closed curves, the two cases being distinguished by the value of the attribute . In the general curve case, no specific structural relationships are required between the elements of the sketch.
An instance of Sketch_2d_representation may be associated with a . This permits the association of parameters and constraints with the geometric elements of the sketch.
The semantics of this entity are not fully defined here, the corresponding MIM entity has additional constraints on the geometric elements.
a two-valued attribute determining whether the sketch is to be interpreted as a set of general curves or as the area bounded by a set of closed curves.
a set of points and curves that compose the geometry of the sketch.
The dimensionality of the geometric coordinate space that is the representation context of the Sketch_2d_representation shall be 2.

A Subsketch is a type of that defines a partial sketch in terms of a subset of the geometric elements composing a full sketch.
The semantics of this entity are not fully defined here; the corresponding MIM entity has additional formal rule to ensure that all geometric elements belonging to the Subsketch shall be used, directly or indirectly, by the owning sketch.
the set of geometric elements composing the Subsketch.
the sketch of which the Subsketch is a part..
